ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Visit name
What time do you usually go to bed on school days? (List one time, not a range)
Notes: HH:MM

ElementDescription: What time do you usually go to bed on school days? AM or PM
What time do you usually go to bed on school/work days? Military Time
Notes: HH:MM

ElementDescription: There are many reasons for doing things at one time or another. What is the main reason you usually go to bed at this time on school days? (choose one)
Notes: 1 = My parent have set my bedtims; 2 = I feel sleepy; 3 = I finish my homework; 4 = My TV shows are over; 5 = My brother(s) or sister(s) go to bed; 6 = I finish talking to my friends; 7 = I get home from my job; 8 = Other

ElementDescription: What is the main reason you usually go to bed at this time on school days? If Other: specify
What time do you usually wake up on school days?
Notes: HH:MM

ElementDescription: What time do you usually wake up on school days? AM or PM
What time do you usually wake up on school/work days? Military Time
Notes: HH:MM

ElementDescription: What is the main reason you usually wake up at this time on school days? (choose one)
Notes: 1 = Noises or my pet wakes me up; 2 = My alarm clock wakes me up; 3 = My parents or other family members wake me up; 4 = I need to go to the bathroom; 5 = I don't know, I just wake up; 6 = Other

ElementDescription: What is the main reason you usually wake up at this time on school days? If Other: specify
Think how long you usually sleep on a normal school night and fill it in here. (Do not include time you spend awake in bed. Remember to mark hours and minutes, even if minutes are zero).
Notes: HH:MM

ElementDescription: On school days, after you go to bed at night, about how long does it usually take you to fall asleep?
Notes: In minutes

ElementDescription: What time do you usually go to bed on weekends?
Notes: HH:MM

ElementDescription: What time do you usually go to bed on weekends? AM or PM
What time do you usually go to bed on weekends/days off work? Military Time
Notes: HH:MM

ElementDescription: There are many reasons for doing things at one time or another. What is the main reason you usually go to bed at this time on weekends? (choose one)
Notes: 1 = My parent have set my bedtims; 2 = I feel sleepy; 3 = I finish my homework; 4 = My TV shows are over; 5 = My brother(s) or sister(s) go to bed; 6 = I finish talking to my friends; 7 = I get home from my job; 8 = Other

ElementDescription: What is the main reason you usually go to bed at this time on weekends? If Other: specify
What time do you usually wake up on weekends?
Notes: HH:MM

ElementDescription: What time do you usually wake up on weekends? AM or PM
What time do you usually wake up on weekends/days off work? Military Time
Notes: HH:MM

ElementDescription: What is the main reason you usually wake up at this time on weekends? (choose one)
Notes: 1 = Noises or my pet wakes me up; 2 = My alarm clock wakes me up; 3 = My parents or other family members wake me up; 4 = I need to go to the bathroom; 5 = I don't know, I just wake up; 6 = Other

ElementDescription: What is the main reason you usually wake up at this time on weekends? If Other: specify

Think how long you usually sleep on a night when you do not have school the next day (such as a weekend night) and fill it in here. (Do not include time you spend awake in bed. Remember to mark hours and minutes, even if minutes are zero).
Notes: HH:MM

ElementDescription: On weekends, after you go to bed at night, about how long does it take you to fall asleep?
Notes: In minutes

ElementDescription: Some people wake up during the night. Others never do. How many times do you usually wake up at night?
Notes: 1 = Never; 2 = Once; 3 = 2 or3 times; 4 = More than 3 times; 5 = I have no idea

ElementDescription: People sometimes feel sleepy during the daytime. During your daytime activities, how much of a problem do you have with sleepiness (feeling sleepy, struggling to stay awake)?
Notes: 1 = No problem at all; 2 = A little problem; 3 = More than a little problem; 4 = A big problem; 5 = A very big problems

ElementDescription: Some people take naps in the daytime every day, others never do. When do you nap? (mark all that apply)
Notes: 1 = I never nap; 2 = I sometimes nap on school days; 3 = I sometimes nap on weekends; 4 = I never nap unless I am sick

ElementDescription: Can you figure out how much sleep you need? Fill out below how much sleep you think you would need each night to feel your best every day. (Remember to mark hours and minutes even if minutes are zero).
Notes: HH:MM

ElementDescription: In general, do you feel you usually get
Notes: 1 = too little sleep; 2 = enough sleep; 3 = too much sleep

ElementDescription: Do you consider yourself to be
Notes: 1 = a good sleeper?; 2 = a poor sleeper?

ElementDescription: How often do you think that you get enough sleep?
Notes: 1 = Never; 2 = Rarely; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Usually; 5 = Always

ElementDescription: Imagine: School is cancelled! You can get up whenever you want to. When would you get out of bed? Between:
Is it easy for you to get up in the morning?
Notes: 1 = No way; 2 = Sort of; 3 = Easy; 4 = Very easy

ElementDescription: If gym class is set for 7:00 in the morning. How do you think you'll do?
Notes: 1 = My best; 2 = Okay; 3 = Worse than usual; 4 = Awful

ElementDescription: The bad news: You have to take a two-hour test. The good news: You can take it when you think you'll do your best. What time is that?
When do you have the most energy to do your favorite things?
Notes: 1 = Morning I am tired in the evening.; 2 = Morning more than evening.; 3 = Evening more than morning.; 4 = Evening I am tired in the morning.

ElementDescription: Your parents have decided to let you set your own bed time. What time would pick? Between:
How alert are you in the first half hour you're up?
Notes: 1 = Out of it; 2 = A little dazed; 3 = Okay; 4 = Ready to take on the world

ElementDescription: When does your body start to tell you it's time for bed (even if you ignore it) Between:
Say you had to get up at 6:00 a.m. every morning: What would it be like?
Notes: 1 = Awful; 2 = Not so great; 3 = Okay (if I have to); 4 = Fine, no problem

ElementDescription: When you wake up in the morning how long does it take for you to be totally "with it"?
Notes: 1 = 0 to 10 minutes; 2 = 11 to 20 minutes; 3 = 21 to 40 minutes; 4 = More than 40 minutes

ElementDescription: Form used/assessment name
During the past month, how would you rate your sleep quality overall?
Notes: 0= Very good; 1= Fairly good; 2= Fairly bad; 3= Very bad; -99= N/A; 77= Refused; 88= Missing; 444= Do not wish to respond; 888= Skipped; 777= Condition Skipped; 7777 = participant should have replied but did not (accidental or intentional skip); 9999 = No data (participant did not see/complete that scale)

ElementDescription: On school nights, I go to bed at: (hour)
On school nights, I go to bed at: (minute)
School Nights Bed time AM/PM:
Notes: 1=AM; 2=PM

ElementDescription: Are you more of a morning bird or night owl?
Notes: 1=Definitely a Morning Bird (I feel my best in the morning); 2=Rather a Morning Bird than a Night Owl; 3=Neither a Morning Bird nor a Night Owl; 4=Rather a Night Owl than a Morning Bird; 5=Definitely a Night Owl (I feel my best in the evening); 6=I do not know

ElementDescription: Timepoint/visit label
It takes me longer than 30 minutes to fall asleep after going to bed.
Notes: 0=Never, 0 Nights Per Week; 1=Once in a while, 1-2 Nights Per Week; 2=Sometimes, 2-3 Nights Per Week; 3=Quite Often, 4-5 nights Per Week; 4=Frequently, 5-6 nights Per Week; 5=Always, 7 Nights Per Week

ElementDescription: In general, I have trouble going to sleep.

ElementDescription: During the night, I wake up more than once.

ElementDescription: After waking up during the night, I have trouble returning to sleep.

ElementDescription: I feel sleepy during the day.
